required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of Magneto Microcatheter
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of Magneto Microcatheter for Endovascular Thrombectomy in Patients With Acute Ischemic Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, open label single arm feasibility study to evaluate the safety and performance of the Magneto Microcatheter in patients diagnosed with acute ischemic stroke and planned for thrombectomy procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the safety of Magneto Microcatheter in the acute post procedure duration by assessing the incidence of device related Serious Adverse Events within 24 hours post procedure
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of device related Serious Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the safety of Magneto Microcatheter by assessing the incidence of device related Serious Adverse Events within 90 days post procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence of device related Serious Adverse Events

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the performance of Magneto Microcatheter by assessing its ability to remove the clot and evaluating its ease of use
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of device performance in clot removal (TICI scale to evaluate revascularization) and ease of use (questionnaire that will be completed by the treating physician post procedure)

intervention.description: All patients will be treated with Magneto Microcatheter

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Clinical signs consistent with acute ischemic stroke
2. Patient with Acute Ischemic Stroke within 24 hours from symptoms o
3. Age 18-85 years old
4. Consent process is completed per international and local regulations
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Known use of cocaine or other vasoactive substance
2. Known bleeding diathesis
3. Any known hemorrhagic or coagulation deficiency.
4. Current use of oral anticoagulants with International Normalized Ratio (INR) > 3;
5. PTT (Partial Thromboplastin Time)>2 at screening
6. Uncontrolled hypertension (Systolic blood pressure>185 or Diastolic blood pressure>110) refractory to pharmacological management
7. Pregnant or lactating female
8. CT scan or MRI with evidence of acute intracranial hemorrhage, ASPECT score<6, mass effect and/or intracranial tumor
9. Angiographic evidence of either carotid dissection or vasculitis at the target site or any condition that may limit device access to the target site (i.e high grade stenosis) per the treating physician's discretion.
